quiz.question: What is the main purpose of the controlling function in management?

options.a: To ensure that activities are performed according to plans.
options.b: To plan the future course of action.

quiz.question: Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of controlling?
What is the primary focus of Feed Forward Control?

options.a: Evaluating results after the task is completed.
options.c: Anticipating potential problems and preventing them.
options.d: Making adjustments based on past feedback.

quiz.question: Which of the following is an example of Concurrent Control?

options.a: A supervisor monitoring assembly line workers.
options.b: Conducting market research before launching a product.
options.c: Analyzing customer feedback after a product launch.
options.d: Providing induction training to new employees.

quiz.question: Feedback control is applied in which of the following scenarios?

options.a: Monitoring raw material quality before production.
options.b: Adjusting the timeline for a project in progress.
options.c: Reviewing annual financial reports to refine budgeting.
options.d: Supervising employees during a task to ensure compliance.

quiz.question: Which of the following is NOT an example of a forward-looking control?

options.a: Designing a curriculum aligned with educational goals.
options.b: Evaluating customer satisfaction after a product launch.
options.c: Conducting quality checks on raw materials before production.
options.d: Introducing training programs to prevent future errors.

quiz.question: Which of the following best defines concurrent control?

options.a: It focuses on correcting issues after the task is completed.
options.b: It is applied during the execution of tasks to ensure standards are followed.
options.c: It anticipates and prevents potential deviations before they occur.
options.d: It is the process of analyzing past performance to make future decisions.

quiz.question: Which of the following is an example of the top-down nature of the controlling function?

options.a: A CEO setting quarterly financial targets for the organization.
options.b: A principal reviewing lesson plans for teachers.
options.c: A teacher analyzing student examination results.
options.d: A factory supervisor monitoring the quality of products during production.

quiz.question: Which of the following is a potential challenge in the controlling process?

options.b: Excessive feedback and low employee involvement.
options.c: Clear objectives and accurate data collection.
options.d: Effective planning and training of employees.

quiz.question: Which of the following is an example of feedback control in an educational institution?

options.a: Providing workshops to teachers based on curriculum goals.
options.b: Collecting student assessment results to adjust teaching strategies.
options.c: Monitoring classroom behavior during school events.
options.d: Aligning teaching methods with the institution's vision.
